message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SOC, cs.IR 

This paper discusses the challenges of spatial scientometrics focusing on the city level, which involves the collection and processing of bibliometric and scientometric data. The paper is likely to fall under the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.DL (Digital Libraries): This sub-category covers research on information retrieval, digital libraries, and related topics. The paper's focus on bibliometric and scientometric data collection and processing makes it relevant to this sub-category. 
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks): This sub-category covers research on social networks, information networks, and related topics. The paper's focus on spatial analysis and its relevance to policymakers and statistical/economic research organizations make it relevant to this sub-category. 
- cs.CY (Computers and Society): This sub-category covers research on the social and ethical aspects of computing. The paper's focus on how cities can profit from bibliometric and scientometric analysis makes it relevant to this sub-category. 
- cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences): This sub-category covers research on the social and behavioral aspects of computing. The paper's focus on spatial analysis and its relevance to policymakers and statistical/economic research organizations make it relevant to this sub-category.
